title: Hasty Pudding Recipe
description: This is a quick, yummy recipe that makes it's own hard sauce. Serve it with real cream. It's an old German recipe my family has made for many holidays.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines European German Hasty Pudding 4.0 (12) 11 Reviews 4 Photos This is a quick, yummy recipe that makes it's own hard sauce. Serve it with real cream. It's an old German recipe my family has made for many holidays. Submitted by Mrs Shauna Dieter Updated on August 4, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 4 4 Servings: 12 Yield: 12 to 12 servings Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 12 servings 1 cup packed brown sugar 1 teaspoon vanilla extract 2 tablespoons butter 1 cup boiling water ½ cup white sugar ¾ cup all-purpose flour ½ cup milk 1 teaspoon baking powder ¾ cup chopped nuts ½ cup raisins Directions Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch square baking dish. In a medium bowl, mix together brown sugar, boiling water, vanilla, and butter. Pour into prepared baking dish. In a clean bowl, mix together white sugar, flour, milk, baking powder, nuts, and raisins. Drop by spoonfuls on top of the mixture in the baking dish. Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Serve warm. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Hasty Pudding 01 of 04 Photo by  Allrecipes Member 02 of 04 Photo by  Leighmahone 03/20/2020 We made this as a project for my son’s class. Apparently Little House on the Prairie. This was delicious. My son didn’t want nuts or raisins. I would add salt to both syrup and dough though. 03 of 04 Photo by  betsy L 05/28/2007 1 You’ll Also Love German Heart Cookies 2 Ratings Chocolate Sauerkraut Cake II 22 Ratings Fried Quinces, in the Manner of the Countess 2 Ratings Poppyseed Stollen (Mohn Stollen) 6 Ratings German Rocks 14 Ratings Best Homemade Marzipan 4 Ratings German Semolina Pudding 20 Ratings Crescent Butter Biscuits 4 Ratings Holiday Lebkuchen (German Spice Cookies) 4 Ratings Chocolate Lebkuchen 13 Ratings Authentic German Lebkuchen 1 Rating Mandelmakronen (Almond Meringues) 7 Ratings Almond Meringue Cookies 22 Ratings Easy German Cut-Out Cookies 2 Ratings Monika's Oma's Lebkuchen Men 1 Rating Oma Kiener's Hazelnut Christmas Cookies 20 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Mrs Shauna Dieter
instructions: Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Grease a 9 inch square baking dish.;In a medium bowl, mix together brown sugar, boiling water, vanilla, and butter. Pour into prepared baking dish.;In a clean bowl, mix together white sugar, flour, milk, baking powder, nuts, and raisins. Drop by spoonfuls on top of the mixture in the baking dish.;Bake in preheated oven for 30 minutes. Serve warm.
